description: A case's holding or reasoning is questioned by a later case without being overruled

questioned_aspect.description: What aspect is being questioned (holding, reasoning, dicta, interpretation)

questioned_reason.description: Reason why the precedent is being questioned

severity.description: Severity of questioning: mild, moderate, significant, severe

specific_point.description: The specific legal point being questioned

citation_context.description: Context in which the questioning appears

subsequent_treatment.description: How this precedent was treated in later cases

indexes: CREATE INDEX questioned_severity IF NOT EXISTS FOR ()-[r:QUESTIONED_BY]-() ON (r.severity)
CREATE INDEX questioned_aspect IF NOT EXISTS FOR ()-[r:QUESTIONED_BY]-() ON (r.questioned_aspect)
usage_examples:
// Find all cases where a precedent has been questioned
MATCH (questioned:Case {case_id: 'case_bd_sc_2020_123'})<-[q:QUESTIONED_BY]-(questioning:Case)
RETURN questioning.citation, q.questioned_reason, q.severity
ORDER BY questioning.decision_date DESC

// Find severely questioned precedents in constitutional law
MATCH (questioned:Case)<-[q:QUESTIONED_BY]-(questioning:Case)
WHERE questioned.primary_domain = 'Constitutional'
  AND q.severity IN ['significant', 'severe']
RETURN questioned.citation, COUNT(questioning) AS question_count
ORDER BY question_count DESC
